choices.B: Login to the Primary vROps node using SSH, and then copy, compress, and export the files from the /var/log/messages location.
choices.A: Login to each vROps node, and then run the generateSupportBundle.py script.
choices.D: Login to the vROps Primary node, and then run the generateSupportBundle.py script.
choices.C: Create a full support bundle using the vROps UI.

questions.question_text:
A system administrator needs to create a vRealize Operations (vROps) support bundle from an on-premises deployment following an inaccessible vROps User Interface (UI) issue.
Which process will gather the correct information successfully?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct is A you need to log in to all of them - https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2074601

comments.content: picked wrong one its A you need all nodes.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct answer - https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2074601

comments.content: It can't be C, you do not open ports from vCenter but from CP. I think it will be A. From Cloud console you only download OVA.
First is maybe C configure firewall

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I believe its B - page 15 - https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vRealize-Operations-Cloud/services/getting-started.pdf

choices.A: Deploy a Cloud Proxy on-premises, and pair it with vRealize Operations Cloud.
choices.B: Initiate a Cloud Proxy deployment on the cloud console, and pair it with vRealize Operations Cloud.
choices.C: Open firewall ports to vRealize Operations Cloud from the on-premises vCenter, and then add the on-premises deployment.
choices.D: Deploy a vRealize Operations node on-premises, and pair it with vRealize Operations Cloud.

questions.question_text:
An administrator would like to use vRealize Operations Cloud to monitor an on-premises deployment.
Which initial step must the administrator take?

choices.C: Deploy a cloud proxy, and then configure vCenter and ESXi hosts syslog to forward logs to the cloud proxy.
choices.B: vRealize Operations Cloud and vRealize Log Insight Cloud must be enabled in the same organizations.
choices.D: vRealize Operations Cloud and vRealize Log Insight Cloud must be enabled in separate organizations.
choices.A: Deploy the vRealize Operations Cloud Content pack, and configure the adapter to connect to the on-premises vCenter.
choices.E: Deploy an on-premises vRealize Log Insight instance, and configure the integration directly with vRealize Operations Cloud.

questions.question_text: Which two prerequisites are required for integrating vRealize Operations Cloud and vRealize Log Insight Cloud to manage on-premises vSphere environments? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Going with BC

Selected Answer: CE
I think its C and E as you can use cloud proxy or direct integration.

questions.question_text:

Which alert component was used by the administrator?

questions.question_text:
An administrator created a pricing card for a new environment. After the pricing card was created and attached, the administrator immediately checked-the cost dashboard but only sees zero prices for the VMs in the new environment.
What is the reason for this behavior?

choices.C: The cost calculation has not run yet.
choices.D: The pricing card was not attached to the VM resource.
choices.A: The prices are only available for ESXi hosts.
choices.B: A cost-based pricing card was created.
